intro: Trigonella hamosa, commonly known as Egyptian fenugreek, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, with trifoliate leaves and small yellow flowers. Its seeds are used in traditional medicine and as a spice, while the plant itself is valued for its nutritional and medicinal properties. Trigonella hamosa thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in arid and semi-arid environments.
